taskDescription: Uses push-to-talk feature cautiously avoiding spontaneous voice commands
Rejects cognitive games that involve physical movement or feel challenging
Avoids social features like chatting with other users during game sessions
Values formality and privacy in system interactions
Denies sharing personal information with family members and healthcare providers
Schedules offline check-ups instead of using ALFRED’s remote monitoring features
Uses ALFRED solely to manage formal communications on her own terms
Rejects casual or friendly banter through ALFRED as intrusive
Refuses to share cognitive game progress or health data with caregivers or family
Prefers formal communication style from ALFRED, avoiding informal chats or spontaneous messages
Evaluates ALFRED’s features with skepticism, especially regarding privacy
Ensures ALFRED respects personal boundaries even if it limits benefit
Configures ALFRED personally without accepting automatic settings
Rejects installation of new health monitoring apps unless explicitly requested
Ensures no unsolicited notifications or casual chats occur
Manages ALFRED settings to prevent adaptive algorithms from suggesting unwanted activities
Accepts only tailored cognitive activities that do not trigger pessimism or resistance
Values keeping personal data private and maintaining autonomy
Prefers a rehab experience that supports recovery without overwhelming her
Maintain skepticism toward technological innovations in health care
Prefer ALFRED to remain silent unless interaction is initiated
Feel overwhelmed by clinical data and permission requests
Experience emotional discomfort when clinical urgency overrides privacy
